name: The Hummingbird Inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Hummingbird Inn and owners/innkeepers Patty and Dan don’t really need another 4 star review, but they deserve it. We took advantage of the LivingSocial escape package for a Memorial Day getaway and were so thrilled with our experience. The inn was comfy and cozy, lots of places to relax alone or interact with other guests. Part of our package included wine and cheese, which Patty was sweet enough to serve us on the back patio overlooking the creek. The breakfasts were delicious, and they were so wonderful about accommodating my gluten-free needs (they asked about food allergies when we made the reservation, and then again upon arrival) and even had some gluten free cookies placed in the room! The guest rooms were very nicely appointed (best sleep I’ve had in ages!) with wonderful little details like wine glasses and a corkscrew, snacks, and pre-stamped post cards! The inn has wifi and lots of games and movies for entertainment. Overall wonderful scenery and a great place to relax and recharge.
reviews.title: Great Little Getaway
Outstanding!
reviews.text: What a great find! Have nothing but compliments for Patty and Dan and the Hummingbird itself. From the smell of honeysuckle everywhere to the sounds of the trains and creek, we loved every minute of our stay.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked the Teter-Wood room on the bottom floor. There was a door that lead out to a private seating area of which we had our coffee in the morning while in the lovely robes provided.
reviews.title: Enjoyable Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The grounds are beautiful and there's a nice little deck next to the creek. We didn't have time to sit and enjoy the firepit ... maybe next time!
reviews.title: Thank you Patty & Dan!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We took advantage of the package we bought through LivingSocial. Dinner at Brix in Lexington was excellent and we had a wonderful wine-tasting session at the Rockbridge Winery in Raphine.
reviews.title: Wonderful hosts and a beautiful home

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a perfect stay at the Hummingbird Inn. The Franklin Suite was beautiful and so comfortable. We had a great time exploring the area, and the breakfast was delicious. We left so much more relaxed than we were when we arrived.
reviews.title: So relaxing!

reviews.text: Our gracious hosts, Patty and Dan, are wonderful. They have an uncanny sense of knowing when you want to be alone and when you feel like having company. The video on their website describes exactly the way it is – peaceful and charming. We took their suggestions about where to go and what to do in and around the area, and also enjoyed relaxing on the upper deck with wine and cheese.
reviews.title: Terrific!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We found the Inn to be immaculate, the rooms large, the bed comfortable, every amenity imaginable, and breakfasts that were incredibly delicious.
reviews.title: Great for couples wonderful getaway

reviews.text: We’ve seen some comments about the train that goes by but it really wasn’t loud and we found that it only added to the overall charm. We are definitely looking forward to going back to this very special Hummingbird Inn!
reviews.title: delightful quiet B&B

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I booked this from Australia, as I had seen it on NY living social, and we were going to be close to it. Was a bit worried, as we wondered if we would have been better staying in a city, but felt a relaxing few days were just what we needed.
reviews.title: The accomodations were immaculate and the owners were delightful.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This 1853 house, added onto the original 1750 trading post, is one of the nicest B&Bs we've stayed in. The history of the house is fascinating, and Patty will happily share it with you. There are five good-sized guest rooms, all with en suite baths, plus a multitude of common areas with comfy seating both inside and outside. Hummingbird feeders--and hummingbirds, at least in late September--line the upper porch which wraps around the back of the house, overlooking a lovely yard that backs to a brook.
reviews.title: What a delight!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Previous reviews are detailed enough that I'll only add these comments:
reviews.title: This is what a B&B should be!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 1. Patty and Dan are two of the most delightful and gracious innkeepers we've had the pleasure to meet.
reviews.title: The birds and the bees

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 2. The Eleanor Room does has the smallest bathroom (we managed to peek in all the rooms), but the only king bed (the rest are queens). And hey!! Eleanor Roosevelt slept in it!
reviews.title: Fantastic labor day weekend!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 3. No TVs in rooms, but a TV and DVDs available in the den.
reviews.title: Great anniversary weekend!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Hummingbird Inn. Dan and Patty were wonderful hosts and the breakfast on both mornings was delicious! We will definitely be coming back to stay. We got the living social package and it came with so many things for us to do, very fun filled weekend!
reviews.title: Wonderful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our stay was short - only two nights so only one full day, but we made the most of it. Patty and Dan are wonderful hosts and very knowledgeable about the area. Our first night, we went to dinner in Staunton at the Mill Creek Grill. Our whole experience there was great - food, service and the mint ice cream at the end! After our first delicious breakfast, we headed down to the caverns at Natural Bridge. Definitely a must see if you never have. We didn't do Natural Bridge so we could do it as a family with our kiddos. On our way down, we took the Goshen Pass road which was beautiful. I think we stopped every 100 yards once entering the pass to take pictures. It had rained the night before and the water was really flowing. After we left Staunton, we drove to Lexington and took the carriage ride through downtown. Your driver and guide do a great job of shoeing you most of the historic sites in the town and I was amazed at how much history took place right there in Lexington. We finished up with dinner in downtown at the Southern Inn, another wonderful restaurant and topped it off with ice cream from Sweet Things. Yum! We stayed in the Teter-Wood room which is the only room downstairs so it was really very private. The other couples that were there were either in their own rooms on the second floor or out of the house so it was like having the whole downstairs area to yourself! Patty and Dan were great and it was nice to stay in a place that was warm and homey, not cold and impersonal like a hotel.
reviews.title: Just what we needed!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were looking for a weekend trip and decided on the Hummingbird Inn as we saw it on Living Social. The stay was relaxing and enjoyable. Patty and Dan are excellent innkeepers and have a wealth of knowledge to share about the Inn and the surrounding area. You will not want to miss Patty's breakfast as it is a wonderful way to start the day! The Inn was located about midway between Staunton and Lexington. We enjoyed a tour of the area (sites recommended by Patty and Dan) as well as a visit to Washington and Lee College in Lexington. A visit to Thomas J Jackson's house is also a requirement once in town. Later in the day we went to Staunton for dinner and a play at the local theatre. Overall, it was a wonderful way to spend the weekend. Next time we'll need to stay longer!
reviews.title: Relaxing Weekend Getaway

reviews.text: I had never stayed at a B&B before. Being a city girl, the thought of staying in a strangers house scared me. My experience could not have been better.
reviews.title: First time at a B&B...LOVED IT!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Owners are wonderful, the inn was lovely, rooms were spacious, bed was comfortable and the bathroom was clean...what more could you ask for?!?!?!
reviews.title: Relaxing stay for weekend getaway

description: Enjoy a romantic setting and warm country hospitality in our unique bed and breakfast, a Victorian Carpenter Gothic Inn situated in the Virginia railroad town of Goshen. The Inn is centrally located near scenic Goshen Pass on the western edge of the Shenandoah Valley, in a small triangle defined by Lexington, Staunton, and Warm Springs / Hot Springs.Outside the Inn, stroll around an acre of landscaped grounds. Sit on the deck or lie in the hammock and listen to the sounds of the Mill Creek, in the evening, light a fire in the chiminea and enjoy the crisp fall air. For the outdoor lovers, we are close to trails for hiking, biking, plus swimming and kayaking in the Maury River.If you're looking for peace and quiet, cozy and comfortable surroundings that feel like home, we welcome you to our Inn. Come and enjoy Fall in the Shenandoah Valley!
